Package Main

Class Administrator

Object
Administrator
public class Administrator extends Object
The Administrator class provides the functionality for an administrator to manage various operations in a hospital system, including staff management, appointments, medication inventory, and replenishment requests. The class interacts with various submodules like AppointmentManager, InventoryManagement, PrescriptionManagement, and StaffManagement to execute its functionalities.
Since:
2024-11-6
Version:
1.0
Author:
Peter Loh

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    addStaff()
    Adds a new staff member to the hospital staff management system.
    private void
    approveReplenishmentRequests()
    Approves replenishment requests for inventory items by calling appropriate methods from InventoryManagement.
    private void
    filteredView()
    Displays a filtered view of staff members based on category and type.
    void
    menu()
    Displays the main menu for the administrator to choose various options for managing hospital systems.
    private void
    removeStaff()
    Removes a staff member from the hospital staff management system.
    private void
    updateStaff()
    Updates the details of a staff member in the hospital staff management system.
    private void
    viewAndManageInventory()
    Manages the medication inventory, including viewing items, checking low stock, updating thresholds, and restocking items.
    private void
    viewAndManageStaff()
    Manages the hospital staff, allowing the administrator to add, remove, update, or filter staff members.
    private void
    viewAppointmentsDetails()
    Views all appointment details by accessing the AppointmentManager and PrescriptionManagement systems.

  • Constructor Details

    • Administrator

      Administrator(String userID, String userRole, Logger logger, dataReader reader, dataWriter writer)
      Constructor to initialize an Administrator with necessary dependencies.
      Parameters:
      userID - The unique identifier for the administrator.
      userRole - The role of the user (e.g., "Administrator").
      logger - The Logger instance for logging activities.
      reader - DataReader instance to handle reading of data.
      writer - DataWriter instance to handle writing of data.
